title: How accurate is self-testing?
text: The UK has embarked on a programme of self-testing for coronavirus, but can swabs taken at home be trusted? Michael Brooks reports.
abstract: The UK has embarked on a programme of self-testing for coronavirus, but can swabs taken at home be trusted? Michael Brooks reports.

similar.title: Home testing is no quick fix.
text: Home testing is no quick fix.
UK prime minister Boris Johnson says antibody tests for covid-19 are a game changer, but they may not do much in the short term, argues Michael Le Page.
abstract: UK prime minister Boris Johnson says antibody tests for covid-19 are a game changer, but they may not do much in the short term, argues Michael Le Page.

similar.title: Public enemy number one.
text: The new coronavirus is no small threat, but we are starting to understand how it works, reports Michael Marshall.
abstract: The new coronavirus is no small threat, but we are starting to understand how it works, reports Michael Marshall.

similar.title: Race to get ready.
text: As the coronavirus spreads in countries other than China, no nation is fully prepared for a pandemic, reports Michael Le Page.
abstract: As the coronavirus spreads in countries other than China, no nation is fully prepared for a pandemic, reports Michael Le Page.

similar.title: Death rate mystery.
text: Knowing the true rate of death from covid-19 will help us fight the pandemic, but for the moment it eludes us, reports Michael Le Page.
abstract: Knowing the true rate of death from covid-19 will help us fight the pandemic, but for the moment it eludes us, reports Michael Le Page.

similar.title: The race for treatments.
text: It will take time to develop a coronavirus vaccine, but some existing drugs may help save lives before then, says Michael Le Page.
abstract: It will take time to develop a coronavirus vaccine, but some existing drugs may help save lives before then, says Michael Le Page.
